main.name: Jeff Graham
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: My name is Jeff Graham, and Iâ€™m a full stack web developer with Revature. I have experience building full-stack web applications using with React/Redux on the front end, using Express.js on the backend for routing, and using a NoSQL database program, such as DynamoDB, for data storage.
main.contactmessage: Although I'm not currently looking for any new opportunities, my inbox is always open. Whether you have a question or just want to say hi, I'll try my best to get back to you!

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Developed full-stack web applications and built user-friendly websites using React/Redux and used MongoDb for data storage.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Executes full life cycle software development; Documents and maintains software functionality; Writes well designed, testable, efficient code; Integrates software components into a fully functional software system; Develops software verification plans and quality assurance procedures; Tailors and deploys software tools, processes and metrics; Serve as a subject matter expert; Complies with project plans and industry standards.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
